name: AddOrUpdateListMember
description:
Add or update a member in a Mailchimp list.

Use this tool to add a new member to a specific Mailchimp list or update the information of an existing member. This is useful for managing list subscriptions effectively.

parameters.name: unique_list_id
parameters.description: The unique ID identifying the Mailchimp list where members are added or updated.

value_schema.description: The unique ID for the list.

parameters.name: subscriber_identifier
parameters.description: MD5 hash of the lowercase version of the member's email address, email address, or contact ID.

value_schema.description: The MD5 hash of the lowercase version of the list member's email address. This endpoint also accepts a list member's email address or contact_id.

parameters.name: subscriber_data
parameters.description: JSON object with subscriber details including email, status, merge fields, interests, and more.

email_address.description: Email address for a subscriber. This value is required only if the email address is not already present on the list.

status_if_new.description: Subscriber's status. This value is required only if the email address is not already present on the list.

email_type.description: Type of email this member asked to get ('html' or 'text').

merge_fields.description: A dictionary of merge fields where the keys are the merge tags. See the [Merge Fields documentation](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/merge-fields/#structure) for more about the structure.

interests.description: The key of this object's properties is the ID of the interest in question.

marketing_permission_id.description: The id for the marketing permission on the list

enabled.description: If the subscriber has opted-in to the marketing permission.

marketing_permissions.description: The marketing permissions for the subscriber.

ip_signup.description: IP address the subscriber signed up from.

timestamp_signup.description: The date and time the subscriber signed up for the list in ISO 8601 format.

ip_opt.description: The IP address the subscriber used to confirm their opt-in status.

timestamp_opt.description: The date and time the subscriber confirmed their opt-in status in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: bypass_merge_field_check
parameters.description: Set to true to allow member data without required merge fields. Defaults to false.

value_schema.description: If skip_merge_validation is true, member data will be accepted without merge field values, even if the merge field is usually required. This defaults to false.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Mailchimp Marketing API.

parameters.name: skip_merge_validation
parameters.description: If skip_merge_validation is true, member data will be accepted without merge field values, even if the merge field is usually required. This defaults to false.

value_schema.description: If skip_merge_validation is true, member data will be accepted without merge field values, even if the merge field is usually required. This defaults to false.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: The unique ID for the list.

value_schema.description: The unique ID for the list.

parameters.name: subscriber_hash
parameters.description: The MD5 hash of the lowercase version of the list member's email address. This endpoint also accepts a list member's email address or contact_id.

value_schema.description: The MD5 hash of the lowercase version of the list member's email address. This endpoint also accepts a list member's email address or contact_id.

email_address.description: Email address for a subscriber. This value is required only if the email address is not already present on the list.

status_if_new.description: Subscriber's status. This value is required only if the email address is not already present on the list.

email_type.description: Type of email this member asked to get ('html' or 'text').

merge_fields.description: A dictionary of merge fields where the keys are the merge tags. See the [Merge Fields documentation](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/merge-fields/#structure) for more about the structure.

interests.description: The key of this object's properties is the ID of the interest in question.

marketing_permission_id.description: The id for the marketing permission on the list

enabled.description: If the subscriber has opted-in to the marketing permission.

marketing_permissions.description: The marketing permissions for the subscriber.

ip_signup.description: IP address the subscriber signed up from.

timestamp_signup.description: The date and time the subscriber signed up for the list in ISO 8601 format.

ip_opt.description: The IP address the subscriber used to confirm their opt-in status.

timestamp_opt.description: The date and time the subscriber confirmed their opt-in status in ISO 8601 format.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
